Package battleship

Class Ocean

java.lang.Object
battleship.Ocean
public class Ocean
extends java.lang.Object
Contains a 10*10 array of Ships, representing an "ocean" and some methods to manipulate it.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int hitCount
    The number of times a shot hit a ship
    private Ship[][] ships
    Used to determine quickly which ship is in any given location
    private int shipsSunk
    The number of ships sunk (10 ships in total)
    private boolean[][] shotAt
    Used to determine which grid cells have been fired upon
    private int shotsFired
    The total number of shots fired by the user

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Ocean()
    Constructs an "empty" ocean and fills the ships array with EmptySea objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ocean

      public Ocean()
      Constructs an "empty" ocean and fills the ships array with EmptySea objects. Initialize game variables.

  • Method Details

    • placeAllShipsRandomly

      void placeAllShipsRandomly()
      Places all ten ships randomly on the initially empty ocean

    • isOccupied

      boolean isOccupied​(int row, int column)
      Check whether a given location contains a ship.
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      Returns:
      true if the given location contains a ship

    • shootAt

      boolean shootAt​(int row, int column)
      Takes a shot at the location requested by the user. Increments the shotsFired counter, the hitCount, and the shipsSunk count depending on the outcome. Also returns a boolean value.
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      Returns:
      true if the given location contains a ship that is still afloat

    • getShotsFired

      int getShotsFired()
      Returns:
      the number of shots fired in the game

    • getHitCount

      int getHitCount()
      Returns:
      the number of hits recorded in the game

    • getShipsSunk

      int getShipsSunk()
      Returns:
      the number of ships sunk in the game

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      Returns:
      true if all ships have been sunk, otherwise false

    • getShipArray

      public Ship[][] getShipArray()
      Returns:
      the 10x10 array of Ships

    • getShotAtArray

      Returns:
